executive.headline: Promotion Channel Health & Priorities
executive.description: Five channels drive promotion revenue. Three are constrained or underperforming; two are emerging opportunities. Fix measurement and content alignment first.

channels.name: Paid Media
channels.headline: Measurement limits scale; creative testing cadence needed.
findings: Conversion tracking incomplete; true ROAS unknown.
Creative win-rate unclear due to limited test velocity.
recommendations: Fix GA4 eCommerce tracking and conversion actions.
Establish weekly creative test slate (3–5 variants).
Scale winners; cut losers by week 2.

channels.name: SEO
channels.headline: Leverage museum authority; build content handoff to shop.
findings: Museum site has 10K+ monthly organic sessions; shop gets <500.
Low TOFU content targeting art terms; poor internal linking.
Artist pages on museum site don't link to shop products.
recommendations: Create museum-to-shop pathways with reciprocal internal links.
Publish gallery posts and link to relevant PDPs.
Build resource center for street art education + buyer guides.

channels.name: Email/CRM
channels.headline: Reduce spend leakage; align flows with capsule launches.
findings: Flows not aligned to product drops; engagement declining.
recommendations: Migrate to Klaviyo for Shopify-native data sync.
Rebuild flows around 90-day capsule launches.
Implement segmentation by artist affinity and purchase history.

channels.name: Social
channels.headline: Build capsule narratives; seed creators and UGC.
findings: Instagram-first (6.1K followers); TikTok, YouTube, Pinterest missed.
No structured warm-up calendar for drops; reactive launches.
recommendations: Shift to engagement formats (Reels, Lives, Stories).
Activate 5–10 micro-creators with trackable codes.
Run 90-day hype SOP for every collaboration drop.

channels.name: Marketplaces
channels.headline: Launch curated SKUs; ensure schema and imagery meet platform best practices.
findings: Assortment not yet live on Etsy, Amazon, eBay.
Listing readiness high for apparel; low for home decor.
recommendations: Launch 400–600 curated SKUs across channels.
Ensure schema markup and imagery meet platform specs.
Build daily exception monitoring for inventory drift.

keyInsights.title: Measurement is the bottleneck
keyInsights.description: We're spending money on ads and email but don't know what's actually working. Right now, we can't tell if a dollar spent on Google Ads generates $3 or $0.50 in revenue. Until we fix this, we're flying blind—we can't confidently scale what works or cut what doesn't.

keyInsights.title: Content alignment drives revenue
keyInsights.description: When we launch a new product drop, our email, social, and SEO teams aren't coordinated. This means customers see mixed messages, and we miss the peak interest window. Imagine launching a product but only telling some customers about it—that's what's happening now. Coordinating around a 90-day calendar could easily add 20–30% to revenue per launch.

keyInsights.title: Museum site is underutilized
keyInsights.description: Our museum website gets 10,000+ visitors every month who are interested in art and culture. Almost none of them know we have a shop. It's like having a busy art gallery next door but no sign pointing to our store. By linking the museum content to shop products, we could triple traffic to the shop with zero additional ad spend.

keyInsights.title: Creator economy is untapped
keyInsights.description: Right now, we occasionally work with artists and influencers, but there's no system. Imagine if we had 5–10 micro-influencers consistently sharing our products with their audiences (who are exactly our target customers). With trackable promo codes, we'd know exactly which creators drive sales. This could become 20–30% of our social revenue.

notes: Extremely low CTR; negligible revenue (e.g., Nov 1 campaign: 3 orders, none for featured product).
Rising bounces and list fatigue; lack of hygiene and engagement segmentation.
Automation logic flaws (e.g., premature removal), likely hurting upsell/repeat.
Deliverability likely degraded due to list quality and engagement issues.
Consultant at $1,000/mo with limited ROI and no sales growth.

diagnosis.impact: Damaged sender reputation; lower inbox rates

diagnosis.fix: Dynamic segments by behavior, purchases, lifecycle stage.
Modular templates; A/B test subjects, CTAs, layouts.
UTMs + GA4 e‑commerce + CRM revenue tagging.

rationale: Shopify-native integration (real-time orders, browsing, product data).
Automation library for welcome, browse abandon, post-purchase, win-back.

phase1Cleanup: Suppress bounced/invalid emails and non‑engagers (last 10 campaigns).
Validate form sources (ticketing, Wi‑Fi, in‑store, API).
phase2Rebuild: High‑Value (2+ orders, AOV > $100) — VIP early access.
Recent Visitors (viewed, no purchase) — browse re‑engagement.
Product Interest by artist/category — personalized updates.

automations: Welcome Series — introduce brand, bestsellers, artist stories.
Abandoned Cart — recover revenue; time‑bound incentive.
Product Launch — notify relevant audience by artist/product type.
Specialized Artist Drop — teaser → countdown → drop → last chance.

recommendations: Modular templates: hero banner, artist spotlight, dynamic product block (Shopify), strong CTA.
Seasonal themes: Street Art Holiday Gifts; Artist Drop Spotlight; Wynwood Summer Collection.
A/B test subject lines, CTA copy, layout hierarchy.

tracking: GA4 e‑commerce sync; report by campaign, segment, flow.

plan90d: Weeks 1–2: audit/export Mailchimp; identify non‑engagers and bounces.
Weeks 3–4: migrate to Klaviyo; rebuild Welcome, Abandoned Cart, Post‑Purchase.
Month 2: implement segmentation, rebuild templates, launch initial campaigns.
Month 3: layer artist flows; A/B test; optimize timing/frequency; review ROI.
outcomes: 5–10% of total online revenue from email.

performanceSnapshot.description: Last 90 days overview and traffic mix
notes: Brand terms (incl. museum) and Superplastic drive a large portion of clicks. Non-brand growth is the lever for incremental revenue.
performanceSnapshot.mediaNote: Media: GSC snapshots and revenue export (add when available)

oosIssue.title: Issue: Out-of-Stock Pages Deindexed
oosIssue.description: OOS PDPs removed from site drop rankings and link equity
stakeholders: When a product sells out, we lose ranking history and discovery traffic. Competitors keep traffic and capture intent.
technical: Keep PDP live; do not 404/301. Show OOS state with alternatives and "notify me".
Keep canonical URL and include in XML sitemap; use Product schema with availability=OutOfStock.
Hide from collections only (theme condition), not from the index.
Link to closest in-stock equivalents and the parent category.

categoryHubs.description: Turn default Shopify collection pages into content-rich hubs
components: Intro copy with primary KW cluster and internal links.
FAQ schema block for category queries.

media.title: Collections → Fashion (example)
media.description: Illustrative layout for a mini homepage: intro copy, subcategories, featured SKUs, FAQs, and editorial teasers.

contentStrategy.description: Top/middle/bottom funnel content to drive discovery and conversion
tofu: Street art news and culture explainers
Guides: "What is streetwear art?" "How to style [artist] capsule"
mofu: Artist spotlights linking to category hubs and capsules
Material/fit guides for apparel; size charts and care
Collection lookbooks with internal links to PDPs
bofu: Listicles: 'Best gifts for artsy people', 'Top [artist] tees'
Landing pages targeting high-intent queries with schema

media.alt: SERP for gifts for artsy people
media.title: Listicle-style SERP: gifts for artsy people
media.description: Shows dominant formats and angle opportunities for BOFU listicles.

media.title: SEMRush: Mid/Bottom-of-funnel volume
media.description: Keyword volumes and difficulty to prioritize BOFU listicles and artist + product targets.

pressLinks.description: Announce collabs and route museum → shop traffic
bullets: Press releases for new collaborations and capsules; outreach to culture/retail media.
Digital PR (data angles, artist features) to earn links.
Prominent museum → shop links and content embeds; event recaps linking to products.

seasonal.description: Capture seasonal demand with evergreen + timely guides
bullets: Evergreen: gifts for artsy people, streetwear gifts, wall art gifts.
Seasonal: holiday, Black Friday/Cyber Monday, Valentine’s, Father’s/Mother’s Day.
Artist-specific gift guides for high-intent searchers.

roadmap90d.description: Sequenced plan for impact and accountability
steps: Fix OOS handling (keep PDPs live, schema, back-in-stock, internal links).
Stand up 3 category hubs (e.g., Apparel, Books, Figures) with content blocks.
Publish 4 TOFU, 3 MOFU, 3 BOFU pieces; interlink to hubs and PDPs.
Launch PR cycle for new collab; secure 5–10 earned links.
Ship 2 evergreen gift guides; outline seasonal calendar.
Review GSC for non-brand growth; iterate title/meta and internal links.

bullets: 5–10% of total online revenue from email.
Stronger artist‑driven storytelling and visual impact.

conversionIssue.title: Critical Issue: Mixed Conversion Goals
conversionIssue.description: Page views, add_to_cart, and purchases were all set as primary conversions with default values.
conversionIssue.explanation: This teaches Google to chase cheap micro-actions instead of revenue, depressing Target ROAS and masking true performance.
conversionIssue.stakeholders: We've been paying for the wrong success signals. Ads think a page view is a "win," so budgets don't prioritize real buyers.
technical: Keep only purchase as primary (dynamic value).
Mark page_view, add_to_cart, begin_checkout as secondary (observe-only) or remove from bidding.
Reset strategy learning windows where conversion definition changed.

media.title: Before: Mixed conversion goals inflating values
media.description: Multiple primary conversions (page view, add to cart, purchase) with default values mislead bidding and depress ROAS.

media.title: After: Correct conversion setup
media.description: Assist events set to Secondary and values removed. Only Purchase remains Primary with dynamic value.

feedOptimization.title: Feed Optimization: Titles & Attributes
feedOptimization.description: Shopify-facing titles don't maximize Shopping query relevance.
feedOptimization.explanation: Shopping performance hinges on query-match and data richness. Add missing attributes and keyword context to win more auctions at lower CPCs.
actions: Enrich GTIN/brand, Google category, MPN; fix price/availability parity.

media.title: Duplicate product sources in data feed
media.description: Illustrates overlapping sources that can create mismatches in availability/price or duplicate items.

media.title: Specialized keyword-maximized titles (example)
media.description: Channel-optimized title patterns to lift Shopping query relevance and CTR.

campaignStructure.title: Campaign Structure: Control & Scale
campaignStructure.description: Current structure is too simple; lacks control and signal isolation.
architecture: PMax split by category/intent tiers (e.g., Apparel, Books, Figures; Prospecting vs. Remarketing).
Shopping campaigns with single-product ad groups (SPAG) for top SKUs to control negatives and budgets.
Search campaigns only for discovery/long-tail support; brand vs. non-brand split.
cadence: Creative/test slate every week (5–10 variants); 7-day read.
Scale winners; rotate 20–30% of budget to tests.
Query/product report review; add negatives; reallocate to ROAS winners.

media.title: Shopping campaign: Fashion → Hats (SPAG)
media.description: Each ad group targets a single product to control negatives, bids, and budgets precisely.

metaAds.title: Meta/Facebook Ads
metaAds.description: Budget ~$900/mo; generic campaigns; product feed only.
recommendations: Campaign layers: Prospecting (creatives by capsule/artist), Retargeting (catalog + UGC), Loyalty (LTV offers).
Creative cadence: weekly tests (hooks, formats, UGC, motion); keep 2–3 evergreen winners live.
Amplify product feed with lifestyle creatives; test Advantage+ Shopping where applicable.

media.title: Multi-angle creative testing on Meta
media.description: UGC, carousel, lifestyle video and imagery variants run in parallel; scale the winners while rotating 20–30% budget to new tests.

amazonAds.title: Amazon Ads & Future Marketplaces
amazonAds.description: No paid support; essential for product traction when search demand is low.
recommendations: Launch Sponsored Products for priority SKUs; use exact/phrase for control.
Add Sponsored Brands (if eligible) once catalog depth exists.
Replicate playbook for Etsy/eBay launches with paid amplification.
amazonAds.warning: Some products should run artist-specific ads only. Avoid broad keywords where we're price-disadvantaged (e.g., generic sticker terms dominated by 200-pack for $9.99) to prevent wasted spend.

media.title: Sponsored banner placement
media.description: High-visibility placement for branded or category terms when eligible.

media.title: Sponsored results grid
media.description: Illustrates how paid placements appear alongside organic results and how relevance impacts CTR.

media.title: Sponsored video banners
media.description: Video formats to showcase capsule stories and product benefits; strong for top-of-search visibility.

actionPlan14d.title: Next 14 Days: Action Plan
actionPlan14d.description: Clear sequence for impact and accountability.
steps: Fix conversion goals (Purchase only as primary) and values.
Rebuild bid strategies; reset learning as needed.
Create feed title templates and channel fields; enrich attributes.
Split PMax by category; create SPAG for top SKUs.
Stand up Meta layers with creative test slate.
Launch initial Amazon Sponsored Products for 10–20 SKUs.

snapshot.title: Current State: Instagram-First, Promotion-Heavy
snapshot.description: The shop runs @wynwoodwallsshopofficial (≈6.1K followers, 720+ posts). Content focuses on products, artist collabs, and event notices; engagement looks moderate. Creators captured when on-site; otherwise hit or miss. Local programming over-communicated; artist story underplayed.
platforms: Facebook: Exists but not clearly optimized; accessibility friction
YouTube: Presence acknowledged as missed opportunity
TikTok: Recognized gap; no active strategy
Pinterest: Not leveraged for discovery or lookbooks

gaps.issue: No structured warm-up calendar for drops
gaps.description: Marketing engages after 3-month production cycle; drops don't spike because hype isn't built ahead of time. Result: reactive launches with no pre-launch momentum.
Over-reliance on Instagram; limited leverage of TikTok, Pinterest, YouTube for discovery and longer-form storytelling. Missing 70%+ of potential audience.
Login wall / configuration friction; no clear content approach or accessibility plan. Page exists but underutilized for community and event storytelling.
Team wants artist storytelling, behind-the-scenes, and education, but it isn't routinized into a calendar and playbooks. Content is ad-hoc and inconsistent.
High-authority artist pages on main site aren't consistently funneling to shoppable products. Missed internal link opportunities and product discovery.
Creators engaged only when on-site. No systematic way to seed products, track performance, or build long-term relationships. Missed affiliate/revenue opportunities.

social.findings: Story not consistently "wearable art"; UGC underutilized. Instagram-first, promotion-heavy; TikTok, YouTube, Pinterest are missed opportunities. No warm-up calendar for drops; reactive launches.
social.recommendations: Build capsule narratives with 90-day drop SOP; seed creators and UGC; shift to engagement formats; fix Facebook; test Live Shopping.
social.evidence: Post comps, UGC examples, artist interview transcripts, drop performance data

marketplaces.findings: Assortment not yet live; high readiness for apparel & books.
marketplaces.recommendations: Launch curated SKUs on Etsy/Amazon; ensure schema & imagery are compliant.
